intro: Trichilia maynasiana subsp. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf trichilia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a habitat and food source. The subspecies is valued for its hard, durable wood, though it is also threatened by habitat loss.
